para.sentence: In this subsection see §§10.2(ii), 10.25(ii) for the functions J_{2\mu} , I_{2\mu} , and K_{2\mu} , and §§15.1, 15.2(i) for {{}_{2}{\mathbf{F}}_{1}}.

W_{\kappa,\mu}\left(z\right)=\frac{z^{\mu+\frac{1}{2}}2^{-2\mu}}{\Gamma\left( \frac{1}{2}+\mu-\kappa\right)}\*\int_{1}^{\infty}e^{-\frac{1}{2}zt}(t-1)^{\mu- \frac{1}{2}-\kappa}(t+1)^{\mu-\frac{1}{2}+\kappa}\mathrm{d}t, if \Re\mu+\tfrac{1}{2}>\Re\kappa, |\operatorname{ph}{z}|<\frac{1}{2}\pi, W_{\kappa,\mu}\left(z\right)=\frac{e^{-\frac{1}{2}z}z^{\kappa+1}}{\Gamma\left( \frac{1}{2}+\mu-\kappa\right)\Gamma\left(\frac{1}{2}-\mu-\kappa\right)}\*\int_ {0}^{\infty}\frac{W_{-\kappa,\mu}\left(t\right)e^{-\frac{1}{2}t}t^{-\kappa-1}} {t+z}\mathrm{d}t, if |\operatorname{ph}{z}|<\pi, \Re(\frac{1}{2}+\mu-\kappa)>\max\left(2\Re\mu,0\right), W_{\kappa,\mu}\left(z\right)=\frac{(-1)^{n}e^{-\frac{1}{2}z}z^{\frac{1}{2}-\mu -n}}{\Gamma\left(1+2\mu\right)\Gamma\left(\frac{1}{2}-\mu-\kappa\right)}\*\int _{0}^{\infty}\frac{M_{-\kappa,\mu}\left(t\right)e^{-\frac{1}{2}t}t^{n+\mu- \frac{1}{2}}}{t+z}\mathrm{d}t, if |\operatorname{ph}z|<\pi, n=0,1,2,\dots, -\Re(1+2\mu)<n<\left|\Re\mu\right|+\Re\kappa<\tfrac{1}{2}, W_{\kappa,\mu}\left(z\right)=\frac{2\sqrt{z}e^{-\frac{1}{2}z}}{\Gamma\left( \frac{1}{2}+\mu-\kappa\right)\Gamma\left(\frac{1}{2}-\mu-\kappa\right)}\*\int_ {0}^{\infty}e^{-t}t^{-\kappa-\frac{1}{2}}K_{2\mu}\left(2\sqrt{zt}\right) \mathrm{d}t, if \Re(\mu-\kappa)+\tfrac{1}{2}>0, W_{\kappa,\mu}\left(z\right)=e^{-\frac{1}{2}z}z^{\kappa+c}\*\int_{0}^{\infty}e ^{-zt}t^{c-1}{{}_{2}{\mathbf{F}}_{1}}\left({\tfrac{1}{2}+\mu-\kappa,\tfrac{1}{ 2}-\mu-\kappa\atop c};-t\right)\mathrm{d}t, if |\operatorname{ph}{z}|<\frac{1}{2}\pi, where c is arbitrary, \Re c>0.
For contour integral representations combine (13.14.2) and (13.14.3) with §13.4(ii).
SeeBuchholz (1969, §2.3), Erdélyi et al. (1953a, §6.11.3), andSlater (1960, Chapter 3).

If \tfrac{1}{2}+\mu-\kappa\neq 0,-1,-2,\dots , then \frac{1}{\Gamma\left(1+2\mu\right)}M_{\kappa,\mu}\left(e^{\pm\pi\mathrm{i}}z \right)=\frac{e^{\frac{1}{2}z\pm(\frac{1}{2}+\mu)\pi\mathrm{i}}}{2\pi\mathrm{i }\Gamma\left(\frac{1}{2}+\mu-\kappa\right)}\*\int_{-\mathrm{i}\infty}^{\mathrm {i}\infty}\frac{\Gamma\left(t-\kappa\right)\Gamma\left(\frac{1}{2}+\mu-t\right )}{\Gamma\left(\frac{1}{2}+\mu+t\right)}z^{t}\mathrm{d}t, if |\operatorname{ph}{z}|<\tfrac{1}{2}\pi, where the contour of integration separates the poles of \Gamma\left(t-\kappa\right) from those of \Gamma\left(\frac{1}{2}+\mu-t\right).

If \tfrac{1}{2}\pm\mu-\kappa\neq 0,-1,-2,\dots , then W_{\kappa,\mu}\left(z\right)=\frac{e^{-\frac{1}{2}z}}{2\pi\mathrm{i}}\*\int_{- \mathrm{i}\infty}^{\mathrm{i}\infty}\frac{\Gamma\left(\frac{1}{2}+\mu+t\right) \Gamma\left(\frac{1}{2}-\mu+t\right)\Gamma\left(-\kappa-t\right)}{\Gamma\left( \frac{1}{2}+\mu-\kappa\right)\Gamma\left(\frac{1}{2}-\mu-\kappa\right)}z^{-t} \mathrm{d}t, if |\operatorname{ph}{z}|<\tfrac{3}{2}\pi, where the contour of integration separates the poles of \Gamma\left(\frac{1}{2}+\mu+t\right)\Gamma\left(\frac{1}{2}-\mu+t\right) from those of \Gamma\left(-\kappa-t\right).

W_{\kappa,\mu}\left(z\right)=\frac{e^{\frac{1}{2}z}}{2\pi\mathrm{i}}\int_{- \mathrm{i}\infty}^{\mathrm{i}\infty}\frac{\Gamma\left(\frac{1}{2}+\mu+t\right) \Gamma\left(\frac{1}{2}-\mu+t\right)}{\Gamma\left(1-\kappa+t\right)}z^{-t} \mathrm{d}t, if |\operatorname{ph}{z}|<\tfrac{1}{2}\pi, where the contour of integration passes all the poles of \Gamma\left(\frac{1}{2}+\mu+t\right)\Gamma\left(\frac{1}{2}-\mu+t\right) on the right-hand side.
